intro: Tarenna sambucina var. tahitensis, commonly known as Tahitian elderberry, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value and culinary uses make it a notable species in horticulture and traditional food practices.
